question.title: Visual Studio: error in library imports of springframework. Package does not exist
question.body:
I was making a little project, but when a start with spring libraries i have a problem, VSC mark the "org" like a error.

package pe.pildoras.ioc;

import org.springframework.context.support.ClassPathXmlApplicationContext;
import org.apache.*;

public class UsoEmpleados {
    public static void main(String [] args){

        ClassPathXmlApplicationContext contexto = new ClassPathXmlApplicationContext();
     
        System.out.println("todo bien");

    }
    
}

package org.springframework.context.support does not exist
package import org.apache does not exist.

The problem is always in the org of the imports.

enter image description here

The project compiles without problem, is just the message error. I have the libraries correctly imported, (without maven or gradle, all manual just to learn).

I tested the same project with the same configuration in net beans and there is any problem.

pd: a had a problem with packages too with created classes, but the error disappear after use "clean java language server workspace"

package pe.pildoras.ioc;

public class ejemplo {

}

error: Incorrect Package
